alert.note: Alert for Debeque to Silt Corridor; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:23PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Garfield County through 500 PM MDT... At 422 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of De Beque, or 27 miles northeast of Grand Junction, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Excess runoff of the Pine Gulch burn scar is also possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Garfield County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Debeque to Silt Corridor; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus
